text: hey, I have an issue with my form on my HubSpot Webpage. When I click on a control box it disappears. What can help to fix this?
Hi Paul - Have you called HubSpot support? Generally, that’s the best place to go for non-technical questions. But - If you post a screenshare video, maybe someone here will see an easy fix.
What do you folks use for code editors? We use Sublime but I’m curious about what other/better options exist.
VSCode, used to use Atom, but it really slowed down once you installed some plugins. Love the split view and integrated terminal in VSCode, and it maintains a lot of the customization that Atom had.

I use sublime and codeanywhere, but because I do a lot of HubSpot work I often use codepen then carry my code over into HS(that way I can use build tools like sass without needing to set up a build process - hate setting up build processes)
Also I’m a fan of being device agnostic.(big reason why I like CodeAnywhere and codepen) There’s also something cool about building websites using websites, it’s like webception. I like not being tied down to a device, with all of my client sites on every platform I can easily hop in and get working from any device including my phone and it’s come in handy.
Will VSCode handle all of your compiling? We use Codekit for that.
<@U7SL518D6> I love working in codepen
mostly for weird JS projects so I can snag dependents easily
I use a gulp-based build system for compiling, so yeah, I'll have that running in an integrated terminal session (another nice feature, multiple integrated terminals running simultaneously lol)

I’m hoping services like codeanywhere really start to flourish - it feels cool to be able to have a “local” copy of a site going while working on it from your phone in the middle of the back-woods - so you can fix an issue without ruining your camping trip (this was a real thing that happened to me once and I was hugely greatful to have been able to do this instead of having to head into town)
hey does anybody know the HubL to have posts listing in order of popularity and not publish date? i know HubSpot can do this but i haven’t had a reason until right now
I think the topic listing module can do this and if you right click on the template you should be able to view hubl source to grab the code they use to do it
yeah that was my next step thanks i’ll let you know what i find
<@U24GZQ3GF> try this: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-popular-posts>
sick thanks… probably won’t be able to have pagination with it but that’s probably not a huge deal to the client
vim
actually, i use sublime as well, but am always curious.  i thought i saw something about Visual Studio Code recently that piqued my interest
Yeah I heard the other guys talking about it and I was curious.
i didnt see the convo below until after i posted this.  I am redundant!
Gotta be more DRY!
Anyone else noticing you can't drag and drop images into the file manger sidebar on posts?
looks like drop zone is only in the red box and not the whole panel as before
I thought I was losing it... Figured it had always been this way I just somehow hadn't noticed
You're not, def used to be able to drag anywhere in there
Lol I thought I was losing it also

Hi all
Does anyone know why this issue occurs?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Custom-Module-Template-Usage-Snippet/td-p/211383>

I have cloned a social share module, however I cannot get it to work via pasting the snippet into hubl markup, nothing loads.  I can however load the custom module from the visual template builder, but I would prefer to use the snippet. I pasted the snippet into the markup as such {% module "module_15426568504431443" module_id="4323014" label="Floating Social" %}
Update:  I figured it out, I needed to add a parameter to the snippet.

Any one have any experience with events? Wondering how you'd develop it in such a way where the most recent couple of events are displayed on the home page. I know you can do this with a blog, pulling the most recent posts.
I've used HubDB for events, then for smaller widget listings pulled the same info from HubDB in a Custom Module with more limited info

The one thing about natively using blogs for upcoming events is that they cannot be future-dated. If you're set on using a blog for events, you can add a custom field to the blog post HTML (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags>)
Otherwise, I've found HubDB/dynamic pages to be the most versatile for listing upcoming events on web pages
I am definitely going to look into codeanywhere
that looks lovel

Hi <@U22PKFRU5> - I noticed that the HubSpot Design certification (2hr 19mins) has been sunsetted and replaced with the CMS for Developers certification (33m).  This is nearly a 2 hour difference in duration (and learning!!).  Do you know why or is there more to come?
Not Luke lol, but I know the new certification is an active initiative on HS's end with a good amount of new content coming soon.
Correct, I believe there are currently only like 2 videos out with more to come

Thanks for the replies yall :luke: - Good question,<@UDYA15HHV> we're releasing lessons in batches of two...
> - there are two live now (Templates and Modules).
> - x2 more will go live (HubDB and HubL) by the end of the year.
> - The rest in early Q1

Then they will all be wrapped up together and turned into the "CMS for Developers" certification.
The Design cert was sunsetted earlier because it was super out of date... more confusing than helpful.
and instead of waiting 6-months to release all new lessons and complete cert... we decided it was better to release them 2 at a time
In the meantime, have you taken a peek at the CMS Discovery Kit <@UDYA15HHV>?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
this is a bit more of a setup and overview... but has links to deeper dive resources.

Is there anyway to see what portals a user is on? For example, we had an associate leave and I know they were added to some of the client portals but I dont know which ones... Is there a quick way to look at a user records and go "Here's a list of portals this users (based on email) has access too"
Also, if I remove the user, what happens to their blogs.... can they still stay with them and have them as an author? (I believe it leaves them but I couldnt remember)

We would love this feature and have requested it. Essentially if someone leaves we change their password to their email. Request password reset via HubSpot and then login as them once we change the password. To see all of the accounts they are on it requires you to login to their HS account. Once we get the list we work through all of the accounts and remove them one portal at a time. I think a list just like academy certifications for all super admins for agencies would be amazing.
Of course brother! We (HubSpot and all the dev community members) really appreciate you helping the community and helping lead the charge to a better tomorrow. :raised_hands:
Yeahhhh, I think it's a manual - portal-by-portal - process. I'll pass along the feedback!
